name: Personal Music Web Site
technologies: Angular 7, JavaScript, JSON, API, HTML5, CSS
description: My personal website with all of my releases, music and DJ mixes.  The site is built completely in Angular 7.  All the data is read from a static JSON file.  The data rarely changes, so there is no need to store the data in a relational database.  Pulling this static data from a file instead of a database eliminates the need for any server side code and keeps the site completely static.  A static site can be hosted very cheaply in the cloud.

screenshots.caption: The front page
List of releases on iTunes.  This page pulls the release info directly from the iTunes API.
Another list of tracks released on iTunes pulled directly from the iTunes API.
A detail page for one of the releases.  This page pulls the list of tracks directly from the iTunes API.
Another detail page for one of the releases, pulled directly from the iTunes API.
List of DJ mixes.  Since this data changes infrequently, the data is pulled from a static JSON file.
Another list of DJ mixes in a different category.  This data comes from a single JSON file.
A third list of DJ mixes.
A detail page for one of the DJ mixes.  Pulled from a static JSON file.
Another detail page for one of the DJ mixes.  Pulled from a static JSON file.
List of places where my music can be purchased.
A simple contact form to send me email.  Using a contact form instead of just listing an email address allows me to control the input and prevents my personal email from being exposed on the site.
